data.label:
Iosef Lancea

”Welcome to the Ministry of Defense, Mr. President. Let's go to my office.“

Iosef Lancea

”You are overstepping and interrupting a personal meeting between me and the President.“

Player

”Valken has a point. The military needs to be on the same page on any changes.“

Narrator

Iosef checked his folder before looking at me.

Narrator

A strong knock on the door was heard and the Chief of the Armed Forces; Valken Kruger walked in quickly with a frown.

Narrator

We walked from corridor to corridor to reach the office. On the way, we were met with high ranking officers as well as privates. Every time one of these soldiers saw me, they stopped and saluted me.

Iosef Lancea

”It is important that you don't get misinformed on this matter. Valken has another agenda.“

Narrator

When we finally arrived at Iosef's office, his entourage saluted us and left. He closed the door and took a seat.

Iosef Lancea

”The situation with Rumburg is getting worse and our lack of funding in the military means that we would fight for survival in a war scenario.“

Player

”What are our options in improving the situation?“

Player

”You have been doing a fantastic job, Iosef. The military is in good hands.“

Player

”I trust that you will defend the country if it comes to the worst.“

Iosef Lancea

”The mandatory conscription law has become a matter of discussion and we need to strike a decision whether to keep it or remove it.“

Narrator

Iosef cleared his throat.

Player

”Whatever is necessary for our survival will be done when the time comes.“

Player

”Isn't Valken the supporter of the quantity over quality approach?“

Valken Kruger

”Why haven't I been invited? What is going on here?“

Iosef Lancea

”We are making all the necessary preparations but any substantial military support from other nations would be a welcome deterrent against Rumburg.“

Player

”Throwing bodies at a problem never solved it. Not sure if this is the right approach.“

Player

”This doctrine worked for decades so far, no reason to change it. I think the generals have a point.“

Iosef Lancea

”I am doing my best to defend the country. There is nothing I care for more than Sordland.“

Iosef Lancea

”Let's hope it doesn't come to that.“

Iosef Lancea

”We have never failed to defend this nation from invaders. We won't start now.“

Iosef Lancea

”With no disrespect to him but he thinks that you can outgun the enemy but when fighting a larger force outsmarting them is what matters.“

Iosef Lancea

”It is the last step remaining to switch to a modern professional armed force.“

Player

”Are reservists really that damaging to the professional armed forces?“

Iosef Lancea

”It will be a bloodbath for both sides.“

Iosef Lancea

”Sure. The new changes will be implemented as you wish.“

Iosef Lancea

”Mr. President, I thought I explained it. Please rethink-.“

Iosef Lancea

”We need all of our resources concentrated on our efficient units that will outperform the enemy in our mountainous terrain.“

Valken Kruger

”Well we can't have less troops on the front-line than the enemy. Not with our current structure focused on mass mobilisation.“

Valken Kruger

”I agree any huge structural change would be too late and too little now.“

Iosef Lancea

”The choice is up to you.“

Valken Kruger

”I mean no disrespect but I am leading the ground operations and I must be informed of any strategic changes.“

Iosef Lancea

”Our restructuring is hindered by a hundred thousands of cadets extending our logistics, slowing command structure and reducing the combat efficiency of our experienced units.“

Player

”The Minister of Defense is your superior and so am I.“

Valken Kruger

”Thank you, Mr. President. We are talking about our national defense which must be consulted among all staff.“

Iosef Lancea

”It depends if this is the President's wish.“

Narrator

Valken left with a hard salute.

Player

”Expand the Army. We need more soldiers to defend our nation.“

Player

”Expand the Navy. We need to increase the amount of our ships.“

Player

”Modernise the Navy. We need a higher-tech navy.“

Player

”Modernise the Army. We need better equipped soldiers.“

Player

”Modernise the Air Force. We need a better air force.“

Valken Kruger

”I could take my leave.“

Player

”Agreed. There is a place for reservists.“

Player

”We don't share the same opinion. This is a modern age and requires a modern army.“

Valken Kruger

”The matter is rather simple from my point of view.“

Valken Kruger

”However, at the end of the day Rumburg has a larger army, air-force and navy. Our conscripts will fill the much needed weaknesses we have.“

Iosef Lancea

”We also have to decide how exactly we spend our additional remaining funds in the military.“

Iosef Lancea

”Let me look over my documents to see if there is anything else of concern.“

Iosef Lancea

”Alright. Then we can move on.“

Iosef Lancea

”That settles it then.“

Valken Kruger

”I would ask you to consider.“

Iosef Lancea

”I don't think it is wise to change course now.“

Player

”Revert the removal of mandatory conscription. That is my final decision.“

Player

”No. I am content with the decision.“

Iosef Lancea

”In June we decided to expand the military.“

Iosef Lancea

”We need to decide what branch we would want to expand further.“

Player

”The Army can be enlarged and match the force size of most neighbours.“

Iosef Lancea

”Strategically speaking the army would be the safest choice. However, the air and naval forces would do well with expansion too.“

Valken Kruger

”Thank you for listening.“

Iosef Lancea

”Each branch would give us an advantage. Our military is larger overall but we can expand the Army, Air Force or Navy even further.“

Player

”Have a good day.“

Player

”Thank you for your time.“

Valken Kruger

”Strategically speaking the army would be the safest choice. However, the air and naval forces would do well with expansion too.“

Valken Kruger

”The Air Force would welcome the addition of new fighters and bombers. The air is the new front.“

Player

”The Army can be enlarged and match the force size of most neighbours.“

Player

”The Navy expansion could protect us from a possible naval incursion.“

Valken Kruger

”We need to decide what branch we would want to expand.“

Iosef Lancea

”We need to decide what branch we would want to modernise more.“

Iosef Lancea

”Our nation has a long coast, a naval modernisation would protect our sea zone. This would be important, especially now that the Heljiland situation between Agnolia and Valgsland is likely to escalate.“

Iosef Lancea

”The Air Force would welcome the addition of modern fighters and bombers. The air is the new front.“

Player

”The Air Force modernisation could give us the battlefield advantage through higher accuracy.“

Player

”The Army could be modernised and match the quality of most neighbours.“

Iosef Lancea

”Which branch should we modernize?“

Narrator

I left the Ministry of Defense and returned to the Maroon Palace.

Narrator

I arrived at the cubic building that housed most of the military command that resided in Holsord. The grey and brutalist structure looked daunting.

Player

”Let's begin. What is the matter?“

Player

”I will make sure it won't come to that.“

Player

”I will make sure it won't come to that.“

Iosef Lancea

”The recent military partnership we have signed with Agnolia includes a mutual-defense clause.“

Iosef Lancea

”Mr. President, we need stronger allies.“

Player

”Do you really think that is absolutely necessary?“

Player

”Sordland stands alone as always, Iosef. We won't rely on help from anyone else.“

Player

”I'd rather prevent a war altogether.“

Player

”I'd rather prevent a war altogether.“

Player

”Let's wait for Valken before we make a decision. I wanna hear his viewpoint.“

Narrator

I thought for a moment before making my decision.

Valken Kruger

”What is the meaning of this?! Iosef?“

Narrator

Valken deliberated the situation.

Valken Kruger

”Disappointing. So this is how the administration conducts matters on military affairs.“

Valken Kruger

”You heard your superior, Iosef.“

Narrator

Iosef threw an angry look at Valken before turning to me.

Player_Italic

I saluted and Iosef saluted back.

Player_Italic

I saluted. Valken and Iosef saluted back.

Player

”Have a good day.“

Player

”Thank you for your time.“

Iosef Lancea

”The Kruger fortification line in construction should help us in the defense of the mountainous and hilly provinces and at the worst case delay a potential advance.“

Iosef Lancea

”As a result of the recent deal with Wehlen, we have started reinforcing the border.“

Iosef Lancea

”We won't, Mr. President.“

Iosef Lancea

”We will try, Mr. President.“

Iosef Lancea

”As a result of the recent deal with Wehlen, we have started organising the troops for the joint operation.“

Player

”Show them the might of the Sordish Armed Forces.“

Iosef Lancea

”The entire world will see, Mr. President. Don't doubt it.“

Iosef Lancea

”Let's move on to our main topic.“

Iosef Lancea

”The facts are that the conscription gives us a large reservist pool that can cover a larger frontline but these troops lack the morale and quality to be offensive elements.“

Iosef Lancea

”My argument would be to remove conscription if our military can stand on it's own two feet without them. If we are going to have strong allies why do we need conscripts?“

Player

”You can stay, Valken.“

Valken Kruger

"Your final decision, Mr. President."

Player

”Tell me what you think, General Kruger.“
